qas.question: What kind of graph is an example of an input used in a decision problem?
What is the term for the set of all connected graphs related to this decision problem?

answers.text: The formal language associated with this decision problem

qas.question: What encoding decision needs to be made in order to determine an exact definition of the formal language?

answers.text: how graphs are encoded as binary strings
how graphs are encoded as binary strings
how graphs are encoded as binary strings

qas.question: What type of graph is an example of an output used in a decision problem?
What is the term for the set of all unconnected graphs related to this decision problem?

plausible_answers.text: how graphs are encoded as binary strings.

qas.question: What encoding decision needs to be made in order to determine an inaccurate definition of the formal language?

plausible_answers.text: one has to decide how graphs are encoded as binary strings.

qas.question: How does one obtain an indefinite definition of this language?

context: An example of a decision problem is the following. The input is an <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2><b3_0>arbitrary<a0_2/><a0_1/> graph<a0_0/>.<b3_0/> The problem consists in deciding whether the given graph is connected, or not. <a1_1><a1_2>The <a1_0><b4_0>formal language<b4_0/><a1_1/><a1_0/> associated with this decision problem<a1_2/> is then the set of all connected graphs—of course, to obtain a precise definition of this language, <b6_0>one has to decide <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2><b5_0>how graphs are encoded as binary strings<a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/>.
